name: Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations
goal: The Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations (FEMA) is the European federation of national road rider organisations. FEMA represents, defends and promotes motorcycling and the interests of million of powered two-wheeler users across Europe. Through its 23 national organisations from 17  countries, FEMA reaches directly 266,000 dedicated motorcyclists representing all social groups.
interests: Competition, Consumers, Energy, Environment, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: EU transport policy, EU road safety strategy, PPE, C-ITS, ADAS, (semi-)automatic driving, urban mobility, multi-modal mobility, EU and UN environment policy, EU energy policy, energy transition, driving licences, sound emissions, EU and UN technical demands regulations, General Safety Regulation, road infrastructure (RISM Directive), transport costs allocation (internalisation of external costs), insurances (MID).
